definition.name: name
definition.documentation: Globally unique name to use for this connector.

definition.name: connector.class
definition.documentation: Name or alias of the class for this connector. Must be a subclass of org.apache.kafka.connect.connector.Connector. If the connector is org.apache.kafka.connect.file.FileStreamSinkConnector, you can either specify this full name,  or use "FileStreamSink" or "FileStreamSinkConnector" to make the configuration a bit shorter

definition.name: tasks.max
definition.documentation: Maximum number of tasks to use for this connector.

definition.name: key.converter
definition.documentation: Converter class used to convert between Kafka Connect format and the serialized form that is written to Kafka. This controls the format of the keys in messages written to or read from Kafka, and since this is independent of connectors it allows any connector to work with any serialization format. Examples of common formats include JSON and Avro.

definition.name: value.converter
definition.documentation: Converter class used to convert between Kafka Connect format and the serialized form that is written to Kafka. This controls the format of the values in messages written to or read from Kafka, and since this is independent of connectors it allows any connector to work with any serialization format. Examples of common formats include JSON and Avro.

definition.name: header.converter
definition.documentation: HeaderConverter class used to convert between Kafka Connect format and the serialized form that is written to Kafka. This controls the format of the header values in messages written to or read from Kafka, and since this is independent of connectors it allows any connector to work with any serialization format. Examples of common formats include JSON and Avro. By default, the SimpleHeaderConverter is used to serialize header values to strings and deserialize them by inferring the schemas.

definition.name: transforms
definition.documentation: Aliases for the transformations to be applied to records.

definition.name: predicates
definition.documentation: Aliases for the predicates used by transformations.

definition.name: config.action.reload
definition.documentation: The action that Connect should take on the connector when changes in external configuration providers result in a change in the connector's configuration properties. A value of 'none' indicates that Connect will do nothing. A value of 'restart' indicates that Connect should restart/reload the connector with the updated configuration properties.The restart may actually be scheduled in the future if the external configuration provider indicates that a configuration value will expire in the future.

definition.name: errors.retry.timeout
definition.documentation: The maximum duration in milliseconds that a failed operation will be reattempted. The default is 0, which means no retries will be attempted. Use -1 for infinite retries.

definition.name: errors.retry.delay.max.ms
definition.documentation: The maximum duration in milliseconds between consecutive retry attempts. Jitter will be added to the delay once this limit is reached to prevent thundering herd issues.
definition.display_name: Maximum Delay Between Retries for Errors

definition.name: errors.tolerance
definition.documentation: Behavior for tolerating errors during connector operation. 'none' is the default value and signals that any error will result in an immediate connector task failure; 'all' changes the behavior to skip over problematic records.

definition.name: errors.log.enable
definition.documentation: If true, write each error and the details of the failed operation and problematic record to the Connect application log. This is 'false' by default, so that only errors that are not tolerated are reported.

definition.name: errors.log.include.messages
definition.documentation: Whether to include in the log the Connect record that resulted in a failure.For sink records, the topic, partition, offset, and timestamp will be logged. For source records, the key and value (and their schemas), all headers, and the timestamp, Kafka topic, Kafka partition, source partition, and source offset will be logged. This is 'false' by default, which will prevent record keys, values, and headers from being written to log files.

definition.name: topic.creation.groups
definition.documentation: Groups of configurations for topics created by source connectors

definition.name: exactly.once.support
definition.documentation: Permitted values are requested, required. If set to "required", forces a preflight check for the connector to ensure that it can provide exactly-once delivery with the given configuration. Some connectors may be capable of providing exactly-once delivery but not signal to Connect that they support this; in that case, documentation for the connector should be consulted carefully before creating it, and the value for this property should be set to "requested". Additionally, if the value is set to "required" but the worker that performs preflight validation does not have exactly-once support enabled for source connectors, requests to create or validate the connector will fail.

definition.name: transaction.boundary
definition.documentation: Permitted values are: poll, interval, connector. If set to 'poll', a new producer transaction will be started and committed for every batch of records that each task from this connector provides to Connect. If set to 'connector', relies on connector-defined transaction boundaries; note that not all connectors are capable of defining their own transaction boundaries, and in that case, attempts to instantiate a connector with this value will fail. Finally, if set to 'interval', commits transactions only after a user-defined time interval has passed.

definition.name: transaction.boundary.interval.ms
definition.documentation: If 'transaction.boundary' is set to 'interval', determines the interval for producer transaction commits by connector tasks. If unset, defaults to the value of the worker-level 'offset.flush.interval.ms' property. It has no effect if a different transaction.boundary is specified.

definition.name: offsets.storage.topic
definition.documentation: The name of a separate offsets topic to use for this connector. If empty or not specified, the workerâ€™s global offsets topic name will be used. If specified, the offsets topic will be created if it does not already exist on the Kafka cluster targeted by this connector (which may be different from the one used for the worker's global offsets topic if the bootstrap.servers property of the connector's producer has been overridden from the worker's). Only applicable in distributed mode; in standalone mode, setting this property will have no effect.

definition.name: topic.prefix
definition.documentation: Topic prefix that identifies and provides a namespace for the particular database server/cluster is capturing changes. The topic prefix should be unique across all other connectors, since it is used as a prefix for all Kafka topic names that receive events emitted by this connector. Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, dots and underscores must be accepted.

definition.name: mongodb.connection.string
definition.documentation: Database connection string.

definition.name: mongodb.hosts
definition.documentation: The hostname and port pairs (in the form 'host' or 'host:port') of the MongoDB server(s) in the replica set.

definition.name: mongodb.user
definition.documentation: Database user for connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

definition.name: mongodb.password
definition.documentation: Password to be used when connecting to MongoDB, if necessary.

definition.name: mongodb.authsource
definition.documentation: Database containing user credentials.

definition.name: connect.backoff.initial.delay.ms
definition.documentation: The initial delay when trying to reconnect to a primary after a connection cannot be made or when no primary is available, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 1 second (1,000 ms).

definition.name: connect.backoff.max.delay.ms
definition.documentation: The maximum delay when trying to reconnect to a primary after a connection cannot be made or when no primary is available, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 120 second (120,000 ms).

definition.name: mongodb.connect.timeout.ms
definition.documentation: The connection timeout, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 10 seconds (10,000 ms).

definition.name: mongodb.heartbeat.frequency.ms
definition.documentation: The frequency that the cluster monitor attempts to reach each server. Defaults to 10 seconds (10,000 ms).

definition.name: mongodb.socket.timeout.ms
definition.documentation: The socket timeout, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 ms.

definition.name: mongodb.server.selection.timeout.ms
definition.documentation: The server selection timeout, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 10 seconds (10,000 ms).

definition.name: mongodb.poll.interval.ms
definition.documentation: Interval for looking for new, removed, or changed replica sets, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 30 seconds (30,000 ms).

definition.name: connect.max.attempts
definition.documentation: Maximum number of failed connection attempts to a replica set primary before an exception occurs and task is aborted. Defaults to 16, which with the defaults for 'connect.backoff.initial.delay.ms' and 'connect.backoff.max.delay.ms' results in just over 20 minutes of attempts before failing.

definition.name: mongodb.members.auto.discover
definition.documentation: Specifies whether the addresses in 'hosts' are seeds that should be used to discover all members of the cluster or replica set ('true'), or whether the address(es) in 'hosts' should be used as is ('false'). The default is 'true'.

definition.name: mongodb.ssl.enabled
definition.documentation: Should connector use SSL to connect to MongoDB instances

definition.name: mongodb.ssl.invalid.hostname.allowed
definition.documentation: Whether invalid host names are allowed when using SSL. If true the connection will not prevent man-in-the-middle attacks
definition.display_name: Allow invalid hostnames for SSL connection

definition.name: cursor.max.await.time.ms
definition.documentation: The maximum processing time in milliseconds to wait for the oplog cursor to process a single poll request
definition.display_name: Server's oplog streaming cursor max await time

definition.name: event.processing.failure.handling.mode
definition.documentation: Specify how failures during processing of events (i.e. when encountering a corrupted event) should be handled, including: 'fail' (the default) an exception indicating the problematic event and its position is raised, causing the connector to be stopped; 'warn' the problematic event and its position will be logged and the event will be skipped; 'ignore' the problematic event will be skipped.

definition.name: max.batch.size
definition.documentation: Maximum size of each batch of source records. Defaults to 2048.

definition.name: max.queue.size
definition.documentation: Maximum size of the queue for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 8192, and should always be larger than the maximum batch size.

definition.name: poll.interval.ms
definition.documentation: Time to wait for new change events to appear after receiving no events, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 500 ms.

definition.name: max.queue.size.in.bytes
definition.documentation: Maximum size of the queue in bytes for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 0. Mean the feature is not enabled
definition.display_name: Change event buffer size in bytes

definition.name: provide.transaction.metadata
definition.documentation: Enables transaction metadata extraction together with event counting
definition.display_name: Store transaction metadata information in a dedicated topic.

definition.name: skipped.operations
definition.documentation: The comma-separated list of operations to skip during streaming, defined as: 'c' for inserts/create; 'u' for updates; 'd' for deletes, 't' for truncates, and 'none' to indicate nothing skipped. By default, only truncate operations will be skipped.

definition.name: snapshot.delay.ms
definition.documentation: A delay period before a snapshot will begin, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 ms.

definition.name: snapshot.include.collection.list
definition.documentation: This setting must be set to specify a list of tables/collections whose snapshot must be taken on creating or restarting the connector.

definition.name: snapshot.fetch.size
definition.documentation: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while performing a snapshot.

definition.name: snapshot.max.threads
definition.documentation: The maximum number of threads used to perform the snapshot. Defaults to 1.

definition.name: retriable.restart.connector.wait.ms
definition.documentation: Time to wait before restarting connector after retriable exception occurs. Defaults to 10000ms.

definition.name: query.fetch.size
definition.documentation: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while streaming. A value of '0' uses the default JDBC fetch size.

definition.name: snapshot.mode
definition.documentation: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Options include: 'initial' (the default) to specify the connector should always perform an initial sync when required; 'never' to specify the connector should never perform an initial sync

definition.name: capture.mode
definition.documentation: The method used to capture changes from MongoDB server. Options include: 'change_streams' to capture changes via MongoDB Change Streams, update events do not contain full documents; 'change_streams_update_full' (the default) to capture changes via MongoDB Change Streams, update events contain full documents

definition.name: schema.name.adjustment.mode
definition.documentation: Specify how schema names should be adjusted for compatibility with the message converter used by the connector, including: 'avro' replaces the characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with underscore; 'none' does not apply any adjustment (default)

definition.name: converters
definition.documentation: Optional list of custom converters that would be used instead of default ones. The converters are defined using '<converter.prefix>.type' config option and configured using options '<converter.prefix>.<option>'
definition.display_name: List of prefixes defining custom values converters.

definition.name: sanitize.field.names
definition.documentation: Whether field names will be sanitized to Avro naming conventions
definition.display_name: Sanitize field names to adhere to Avro naming conventions

definition.name: tombstones.on.delete
definition.documentation: Whether delete operations should be represented by a delete event and a subsequent tombstone event (true) or only by a delete event (false). Emitting the tombstone event (the default behavior) allows Kafka to completely delete all events pertaining to the given key once the source record got deleted.
definition.display_name: Change the behaviour of Debezium with regards to delete operations

definition.name: heartbeat.interval.ms
definition.documentation: Length of an interval in milli-seconds in in which the connector periodically sends heartbeat messages to a heartbeat topic. Use 0 to disable heartbeat messages. Disabled by default.

definition.name: heartbeat.topics.prefix
definition.documentation: The prefix that is used to name heartbeat topics.Defaults to __debezium-heartbeat.
definition.display_name: A prefix used for naming of heartbeat topics

definition.name: signal.data.collection
definition.documentation: The name of the data collection that is used to send signals/commands to Debezium. Signaling is disabled when not set.

definition.name: topic.naming.strategy
definition.documentation: The name of the TopicNamingStrategy class that should be used to determine the topic name for data change, schema change, transaction, heartbeat event etc.

definition.name: database.include.list
definition.documentation: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the database names for which changes are to be captured

definition.name: database.exclude.list
definition.documentation: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the database names for which changes are to be excluded

definition.name: collection.include.list
definition.documentation: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the collection names for which changes are to be captured

definition.name: collection.exclude.list
definition.documentation: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the collection names for which changes are to be excluded

definition.name: field.exclude.list
definition.documentation: A comma-separated list of the fully-qualified names of fields that should be excluded from change event message values

definition.name: field.renames
definition.documentation: A comma-separated list of the fully-qualified replacements of fields that should be used to rename fields in change event message values. Fully-qualified replacements for fields are of the form databaseName.collectionName.fieldName.nestedFieldName:newNestedFieldName, where databaseName and collectionName may contain the wildcard (*) which matches any characters, the colon character (:) is used to determine rename mapping of field.

definition.name: snapshot.collection.filter.overrides
definition.documentation: This property contains a comma-separated list of <dbName>.<collectionName>, for which  the initial snapshot may be a subset of data present in the data source. The subset would be defined by mongodb filter query specified as value for property snapshot.collection.filter.override.<dbname>.<collectionName>
